bestBHT.bht: The promise of joy and gladness is not just about rejoicing, but having cause to rejoice, as it would prove to be a joyful event. The term 'gladness' expresses extreme exultation, and the coming of a prophet will be an occasion for rejoicing. It is not only the family that will be blessed, but many others who will rejoice that he lived. The joy and gladness will be shared by strangers as they would benefit from his teachings.

Henry Alford: There shall be to thee... joy and gladness.
Thou shalt have... joy and gladness.
He shall be to thee... joy and gladness.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: but the meaning rather is, "shall have cause to rejoice"—it
would prove to many a joyful event.
Albert Barnes: Such will be his 'character,' that he will be an honor to the family.
Many will rejoice that he lived.
He will be a blessing to mankind.
Marvin Vincent: Joy and gladness [χαρα και αγαλλιασις] . The latter word exprsses exultant joy. See on 1 Peter 1:6.
John Calvin: He shall be to thee joy...shared alike by strangers, to whom the advantage of his birth should be made known."

It is enough for me, at present, to show briefly that they absurdly torture the words of the angel to mean the annual joy of a birth-day, while the angel restricts his commendation to that joy which all godly persons would derive from the advantage of his instruction."
They rejoiced that a prophet was born to them, by whose ministry they were led to the hope of salvation.
Philip Schaff: Luke 1:14. Many, etc. The promise was not for the father alone; hence the prayer was probably general.
Archibald T. Robertson: Gladness (αγαλλιασις). Only in the LXX and N.T. so far as known. A word for extreme exultation.
Rejoice (χαρησοντα). Second future passive indicative. The coming of a prophet will indeed be an occasion for rejoicing.
John Gill: And thou shalt have joy and gladness... give knowledge of salvation to many, and light to them that were in darkness, and guide their feet in the way of peace."
All which, and more, he afterwards expresses in his song, whereby this part of the angel's prediction had its accomplishment:

Many shall rejoice at his birth; as the neighbours and cousins of his parents did; and not only they, but all others, who, afterwards had knowledge of him as prophet, and as the forerunner of the Messiah.

bhtAttempts.bht: The verse brings a promise of joy and gladness. The commentator emphasizes that the meaning is not just that they would rejoice, but that they would have cause to rejoice, as it would prove to be a joyful event for many. The term gladness expresses extreme exultation, and the coming of a prophet will indeed be an occasion for rejoicing. It is not just the family that will be blessed by his birth, but many others who will rejoice that he lived. The joy and gladness would be shared by strangers as well, as they would benefit from his teachings.

The promise of joy and gladness is not just about rejoicing, but having cause to rejoice, as it would prove to be a joyful event. The term 'gladness' expresses extreme exultation, and the coming of a prophet will be an occasion for rejoicing. It is not only the family that will be blessed, but many others who will rejoice that he lived. The joy and gladness will be shared by strangers as they would benefit from his teachings.

The birth of the child will bring great joy and gladness. Many will find cause to rejoice at the coming of this prophet, as his birth will be an occasion for exultant joy. His arrival will not only bring honor to the family, but will also be a blessing to mankind. This joy and gladness will be shared by strangers as well, as they too will benefit from the advantage of this child's instruction. Through his ministry, he will give knowledge of salvation, bring light to those in darkness, and guide their feet in the way of peace. All of these promises will be fulfilled as many rejoice at his birth and are led to the hope of salvation through his teachings.

The birth of this child will bring immense joy and gladness to all. It is not merely the joy of a birth, but the joyful event that he will prove to be, causing many to rejoice. He will be a prophet and an honor to his family, a blessing to mankind. Strangers will share in the joy as they benefit from his instruction and the hope of salvation he brings. His birth will guide many in the way of peace and enlighten those in darkness.

The birth of this child will bring immense joy and gladness to all. Many will have cause to rejoice at the coming of this prophet, as he will be an occasion for exultant joy. His arrival will honor the family and be a blessing to mankind. Strangers will share in the joy, benefiting from his instruction. Through his ministry, he will give knowledge of salvation, bring light to darkness, and guide people in the way of peace. This child's birth will be a reason for celebration and hope.
